clinical_study.brief_title: Thoracic Epidural Depth in Children Using Magnetic Resonance Imaging.Magnetic Resonance Imaging
clinical_study.official_title: Thoracic Epidural Depth in Children Using Magnetic Resonance Imaging

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the thoracic skin to epidural space depth in children and define the ratio between the straight and inclined thoracic skin to epidural depth.

detailed_description.textblock:
Thoracic epidural in children confers clinical benefits but are technically challenging. The prediction of thoracic skin epidural depth (SED) might increase the success rate and decrease complications. Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is the most comprehensive imaging modality of the spine, and the measurements derived can be more accurate.
The present study is based on Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)-based measurements to evaluate the thoracic SED and define the ratio between the straight and inclined SED at the two thoracic levels (T6-7 and T9-10) in children.

primary_outcome.measure: Depth of thoracic epidural space in children
primary_outcome.description: Derive a formula for predicting the thoracic skin epidural depth in children

study_pop.textblock: MRI images of children aged 1 month to 8 years undergoing Magnetic Resonance Imaging evaluation unrelated to spine pathology were studied.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Children aged 1 month to 8 years undergoing Magnetic Resonance Imaging evaluation
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients with scoliosis, myelomeningocele, tumors of the spinal cord or vertebral bodies, spina bifida, tethered cord, spinal metastasis
